sen.j: 家俊も父とともに応仁の乱では西軍に加勢した。
sen.e: Ietoshi and his father joined the West Camp in the Onin War.

sen.j: 以後も家俊は領国と京都を往復して有力公家と婚姻を結んだり、冷泉為広らと和歌を通じた交流を行っている。
sen.e: Afterwards, Ietoshi had shuttled between his fiefdom and Kyoto, where he had his daughters marry to powerful nobility and got acquainted with Tamehiro REIZEI and others through waka (Japanese poetry).

sen.j: 1531年（享禄4年）、本願寺9世実如と一門衆との争いにより加賀国で発生した大小一揆が勃発すると、蓮能所生の実悟（蓮如の13男）救援のために加賀に出陣するが、本願寺から派遣された討伐軍に敗れて討ち死にした。
sen.e: In 1531, when, triggered by conflict between Jitsunyo the 9th chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple and opponent fractions, small- and large-scale uprisings took place in Kaga Province, Ietoshi and his army headed for Kaga Province to save Jitusugo (13th son of Rennyo), his daughter's son (grandson), but he was killed by enemy dispatched by Hongan-ji Temple.

In 1531 - when, triggered by conflict between Jitsunyo, the 9th chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple, and opposing factions, small- and large-scale uprisings took place in Kaga Province - Ietoshi and his army headed for Kaga Province to save Jitusugo (13th son of Rennyo), Renno's son, but Ietoshi was defeated and killed by enemies dispatched from Hongan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Grammar; replaced "he" with Ietoshi, because otherwise it isn't clear whether it was Ietoshi or Jitsugo who was killed. Also, Renno was Ietoshi's twin sister, not his daughter, so Jitsugo would have been his nephew, not his grandson.
